lexUnit.name: amalgamate.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: combine or unite to form one organization or structure.

sentence.text: For certain businesses the purchaser may require the prior consent or approval of an industry regulator before it can commence the new business or amalgamate it into its existing business .
There is no linkage , no indication of how to amalgamate one step with another and no indication of either rhythm or quality to make the movement come alive .
He led in amalgamating the Royal Clyde with the Royal Northern .
Specific recommendations were aimed at strengthening the police , in manpower , efficiency and pay , and speeding up the process of amalgamating local forces .
Immediately prior to serving , add the prawns and mussels and amalgamate all ingredients , taking care not to break up the fish .
I believe , however , that Schröder has amalgamated two issues — screening and treatment of early prostatic cancer — into one when they should be argued separately .
This is because the choreographer has amalgamated the steps , poses and gestures to make a particular statement about the story , theme or music inspiring the work .
By the close of the nineteenth century funeral furnishers had amalgamated the individual trades of coffin-maker , undertaker and funeral furnisher .
The 1st and 2nd battalions of the Yorkshire Volunteers continue , and the 3rd and 4th will be amalgamated .
The two corps were amalgamated in 1880 as The 7th Battalion .
Before that time the school was to be amalgamated with another local comprehensive .
Schools are often obliged , therefore , to amalgamate two or more classes for massed singing , or to rely heavily upon BBC Schools ' broadcasts .
The selection seems to have taken into account the moves within London University to amalgamate some colleges and form five science centres .
He amalgamated parts of human bodies to create a ` monster " , which he then brought to life .
It was a period of upheaval at OCU and in May 1960 ` A " and ` B " Squadrons amalgamated into a single squadron of two flights .
At 18 she gave up competing to teach , setting up a class in South Shields which she amalgamated with her old school in Jarrow when her own teacher retired .
